page.title: 18ROMSEY POST OFFICE
page.content: Romsey Post Office is quite small, but is still busy. When you enter, there is usually a queue and the place feels like a church quiet, still and slow. The walls of the Post Office are covered with little leaflets telling you train times and about pensions. Behind the counters the people seem very serious and quiet. When letters come in they are split up into districts, then streets then house numbers. Roughly 158,000 letters and 1,000 parcels come in every week. Behind the scenes it feels very sleepy and dusty but also friendly. The Romsey Post Office does not use a computer but it uses the Post Code as a type of computer. Already some businesses are using computers to communicate with each other and maybe in the future this will be more widely used.
